channel.title: Halo 4
channel.description:
well guys its finally here. Microsoft announced it at E3 yesterday and im crying of joy from it. though i dont like that bungie didn't have ONE bit of development in it, just 343 and Microsoft. they're also bringing combat evolved but in not too big on that.
if you want heres the trailer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TC2yMKMENdg

item.title: Halo 4
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“buut15, post:38, topic:398241”][quote author=whip of soulz link=topic=495376.msg3622611#msg3622611 date=1307564260]

I can not wait for Halo 4. Hopefully Microsoft can pull this off. =)

I have been playing Halo since Combat Evolved. Yes, Halo: Reach was the worse of all 4 5 counting ODST, but it was still a good game. All Halo has different strong points. Halo: Combat had the best campaign and started everything. Halo 2 was the beginning of an amazing multiplayer. Halo 3 had the best multiplayer. Halo 3 also started Forge, Theater, and an extremely updated custom games. Halo 3: ODST started Firefight. Halo: Reach was pretty much updating almost everything and tried making everything better. Even if most of it was a fail, the did good in some of it. You need to look more at the positive side of games, not as much as the negative.

Also, I don’t count Halo Wars as one of these Halo games. Halo Wars was something different Bungie wanted to try. It was good, but got boring very fast. =P
[/quote]Bungie didn’t make halo wars?

I guess not. o_O[/quote]
Developer(s)
Ensemble Studios
Robot Entertainment

Read full topic

item.title: Halo 4
item.dc:creator: @buut15 buut15
item.description:
@buut15 wrote:

I can not wait for Halo 4. Hopefully Microsoft can pull this off. =)

I have been playing Halo since Combat Evolved. Yes, Halo: Reach was the worse of all 4 5 counting ODST, but it was still a good game. All Halo has different strong points. Halo: Combat had the best campaign and started everything. Halo 2 was the beginning of an amazing multiplayer. Halo 3 had the best multiplayer. Halo 3 also started Forge, Theater, and an extremely updated custom games. Halo 3: ODST started Firefight. Halo: Reach was pretty much updating almost everything and tried making everything better. Even if most of it was a fail, the did good in some of it. You need to look more at the positive side of games, not as much as the negative.

Also, I don’t count Halo Wars as one of these Halo games. Halo Wars was something different from a different company. It was good, but got boring very fast. =P

Read full topic

item.title: Halo 4
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

The story:
Bungie tried to separate itself from Microsoft. Went to court. Microsoft got Master Chief and Cortonna and Bungie got the rest of Halo. That is why both ODST and Reach did not feature either of these characters. Imagine how painful it was for Bungie to just give up an enriched story which they have built up for years. Btw 343 industries includes Bungie’s former CEO. My guess is that it will be more like the first Halo then the third and on. (Strong campaign/story and great strategy in it’s maps).

Ps: Call of Shit is the worst game you can play. They probably spend more time counting their money then they do actually putting effort into making something new for their half-assed games. The only difference I have seen between MW2 and BO is the dolphin dive.

Read full topic

item.title: Halo 4
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“vexx1345, post:20, topic:398241”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=495376.msg3621756#msg3621756 date=1307484274]
I was actually best at Halo Reach. I won’t be buying Halo 4 as it is being made by a different company, and most likely will not fit the theme. Halo reach ended the series imo.
[/quote]
well halo reach was more of a prequel more than an ending. 343 industries helped with all halo games but bungie isnt helping with halo 4 which means all development is left to microsoft and 343 so more than likely the multiplayer will not be good.[/quote]
Halo reach was a end of the beginning. Its a hard explanation, halo reach was a prequel to halo 1 in story yes. But in actual technology and such, its a new game in the series. I don’t know of a way to explain it further. It was the end of a series, but placed before the first.
